data.headline: S&P 500 closed nearly flat at 6,836 on Friday after a volatile week marked by the worst weekly drop since November
bullets: Softer-than-expected CPI data boosted expectations for Fed rate cuts, supporting bond prices as Treasury yields fell
AI-tech sector pressures persisted, highlighted by Cisco's weak margins contributing to the selloff
No major corporate news, M&A activity, or regulatory updates emerged over the weekend
Carnival Corp CFO insider selling noted but had minimal market impact
Asian markets traded mixed, with some indices lower on continued Wall Street AI concerns
US equity futures showed little movement ahead of Tuesday's open, with markets closed Monday for Presidents' Day
Pre-market earnings from small caps like Sonoco Products (SON) and Otter Tail (OTTR) expected to have limited influence
Traders eye Tuesday's retail sales and business inventories for fresh signals on consumer strength in a holiday-shortened week
